title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
Rising fuel prices are taking a toll on small businesses, prompting owners of everything from furniture retailers to swimming-pool service companies to trim back work and revise contracts as they try to soften the financial hit.

---

Canadian Pacific trains were halted Sunday morning, after an impasse in contract negotiations between the railway and its conductors and engineers.

---

State oil giant Saudi Aramco said its 2021 net profit more than doubled to $110 billion.

---

Nielsen said it rejected a roughly $9 billion takeover offer from a private-equity consortium.

---

Thoma Bravo struck a deal to buy software maker Anaplan for $10.7 billion, the latest in a recent string of big leveraged buyouts.

---

Investors are piling back into U.S. stocks, betting that the domestic equity market can withstand new economic headwinds better than other parts of the world.

---

U.S. importers are starting to reset supply chains to avoid disruptions ahead of contract talks for West Coast dockworkers.

---

Cargo ships are accumulating at one of China's busiest ports after another Covid-19 outbreak shut down factories and warehouses in Shenzhen.

The Shanghai Disney Resort has announced that it will close until further notice, citing China's recent wave of infections.
